description:
Naruto was a young shinobi with an incorrigible knack for mischief. He achieved his dream to become the greatest ninja in the village and his face sits atop the Hokage monument. But this is not his story... A new generation of ninja are ready to take the stage, led by Naruto's own son, Boruto!

(Source: VIZ Media)
synonyms: 博人传 火影忍者新时代
โบรูโตะ: นารูโตะ เน็กซ์ เจนเนเรชั่น

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Dinosaurs
tags.description: Prominently features Dinosaurs, prehistoric reptiles that went extinct millions of years ago.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Cyborg
tags.description: Prominently features a human character whose physiological functions are aided or enhanced by artificial means.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/u_kodachi)
__Hobbies:__ football
Known for his involvement in the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/1735/) franchise.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uezux) | [Website](http://uezu.soregashi.com/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nassy_takanashi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nassy_takanashi/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/64mecceQewFCKwCK6JBW0o)
Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/) where he studied under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/).

Nishio graduated from Nagoya Designer Academy and started his career at Anime Spot, a subcontracting studio, after being refused in interviews with several animation studios. He debuted as an in-betweener on [Osomatsu-kun](https://anilist.co/anime/9883/) and as a key animator on [Laughing Salesman](https://anilist.co/anime/3077/).

It's on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392//) that Nishio came into his own as an animator, developing weighty and realistic movements influenced by [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/). Thanks to the ability demonstrated there, he was chosen to design the characters for [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

After working as character designer and chief animation director on [Jin-Roh](https://anilist.co/anime/570/) he permanently joined Production I.G. where he became known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Kazuchika Kise](https://anilist.co/staff/115781/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

[Masashi Kishimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96879/) requested for Nishio to be the character designer of the Naruto anime.

In August 2020, he was promoted to company director of Production I.G alongside [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/Takayuki-Gotou/), a co-founder of the studio.
Masatoyo Takada is an episode director.

[Website](http://www.realgirlsband.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/realofficial_12) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC38Cc0nADTQ_ibeBdnLQ0ZA/featured) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/real.girlsband/)

ЯeaL (りある) is a female Japanese rock band under SME Records. The band was formed in Osaka on December 8, 2012. 

**Members**
Ryoko (vocal, guitar)
Fumiha (bass, chorus)
Aika (drums, chorus)

*Former*
Yurika (guitar, chorus)

Members: - Nakazono Yuuki (Vocals) - HIROKI (Violin) - Tsuchiya Misato (Guitar) - KENSUKE (Drums)
Coala Mode. is a Japanese unit from Yokohama consisting of vocalist Annyu (あんにゅ) and sound creator Obata Yasuhiro (小幡康裕).

__[Website](https://sky-peace.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/skypeace_teojin) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8_wmm5DX9mb4jrLiw8ZYzw)__

__Formed:__ 2016

__Introduction:__
Sky Peace is a Japanese music unit under record label Sony Music Entertainment, affiliated with Epic Records Japan. The duo consists of Vine star Ooki Terashima and Nico Nico Douga rapper Jin Fujieda, who through a mutual relationship on Twitter decided to form a musical group.

__Members:__
- Theo-kun (テオくん), also known by real name Ooki Terashima (寺島大輝) – vocalist
- Ini (☆イニ☆), also known by real name Jin Fujieda (藤枝仁), otherwise simply known as Jin (じん) – vocalist

name.native: セブン・ビリオン・ドッツ

node.description: Website | Twitter | Instagram | YouTube Biography Seven Billion Dots is a three-piece rock band that formed the 24th of February, 2018. The core members of the band consist of Masafumi Okamoto, a vocalist from the United States with roots in Western house music. The other two members of the band are guitarist Ken Matsuzaki, and drummer Lyo Matsuzaki who, in fact, are real twins. On the 10th of July 2019, the band released their first mini album titled "Pieces", while also announcing a major debut the 11th of December, 2019. The band's major debut will be an E.P, that will release on the already aforementioned date, the 11th of December, which will feature their opening theme song from the anime GRANBLUE FANTASY the Animation Season 2 as the main song. On the 4th of October 2019, the band appeared with the opening theme song for the second anime season of GRANBLUE FANTASY the Animation, respectively named GRANBLUE FANTASY the Animation Season 2, where they presented the song "Stay With Me". On the same day the first episode of the anime aired, they also uploaded the TV-size opening version of the theme song to their official YouTube channel. You can find the music video here: 「Stay With Me -TV-size-」. Record Label: Epic Records Japan (Source(s): rojack.jp, ja.wikipedia.org)

__[Website](https://www.fujifabric.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fujifabric_info) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/fujifabric) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/fujifabricSMEJ)__

__Formed:__ 2000

__Biography:__
Fujifabric was initially formed by Masahiko Shimura in the early 2000s and consisted of five members. They released their first mini album in 2002 titled _A la carte_, and later made their major debut with "Sakura no Kisetsu" through record label EMI Music Japan (known as Toshiba EMI at the time) on April 14, 2004. 

After being active for 9 years, the band would go through a sudden change when Shimura died at the age of 29 on December 24, 2009. At the time the band consisted of four members, Masahiko Shimura, a vocalist and guitarist, Souichirou Yamauchi, a guitarist, Daisuke Kanazawa, a keyboardist, and Shinichi Katou, a bassist. The remaining members decided to continue band activities as a three-piece band, with Souichirou taking over as the vocalist.

__Members:__
- Souichirou Yamauchi (山内総一郎) – vocalist and guitarist
- [Daisuke Kanazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/209456/Daisuke-Kanazawa) (金澤ダイスケ) – keyboardist, lyricist and composer
- Shinichi Katou (加藤慎一) – bassist

__Genres:__ Alternative rock, Pop rock
__Labels:__ Poppo Express - Epic Records Japan

[Official Site](http://thepeggies.jp/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/the_peggies) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3jNmNbqOSajU-pT36HnTJA) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/the_peggies/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/thepeggiesofficial) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@the_peggies_official) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_peggies) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_peggies)

*the peggies* was a Japanese all-woman rock band from Kawasaki, Kanagawa, Japan, formed in 2011.

On July 8, 2022, the band announced that they would be going on indefinite hiatus in September the same year, following the release of a best of compilation album *MMY* and final tour *"the peggies tour 2022 My White"* concluding on September 30, 2022.

__Members:__
• [Yuuho Kitazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/180282/Yuuho-Kitazawa) (vocals and guitarist, songwriter) • [Twitter](https://x.com/poppoexpress)
• Makiko Ishiwatari (bass) • [Twitter](https://x.com/mega_makiko)
• Miku Onuki (drummer) • [Twitter](https://x.com/minimiku0423)

__Raised:__ Tokyo, Japan 
__Height:__ 149 cm 
__Instruments:__ Guitar, piano 

__[Website](https://www.miwa-web.com/bio/) | [Blog (Line)](https://lineblog.me/miwa/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miwastaff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miwa_official_38/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC9cz0t8P3VkTHY7xjbS8zHA)__

Her debut single, “don’t cry anymore”, is being used as the theme song for the Fuji TV drama, Nakanai to Kimeta Hi, starring Eikura Nana.

[Official Site](https://www.sambomaster.co) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sambomaster_txt)

**Sambomaster** is a Japanese rock band signed by Sony Music Japan.  Trivia: The band's name, Sambomaster, refers to the Russian martial art called Sambo.

Members:

- Takashi Yamaguchi  (山口隆) - Lead Vocals, Guitar
- Yasufumi Kiuchi (木内泰史) - Drums, Chorus
- Yoichi Kondou (近藤洋) - Bass, Chorus
